objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the primary author and publisher of this report, providing technical analysis, detection guidance, and YARA rules for identifying Smooth Operator malware.

objects.name: Indicator for 3CXDesktopApp-18.12.416.dmg (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of malicious, trojanised, signed and notarized 3CX software package containing the malicious copy of libffmpeg.dylib.

objects.name: Indicator for 3CXDesktopApp-18.12.416.dmg (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of malicious, trojanised, signed and notarized 3CX software package containing the malicious copy of libffmpeg.dylib.

objects.name: Indicator for 3CXDesktopApp-18.12.416.dmg (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of malicious, trojanised, signed and notarized 3CX software package containing the malicious copy of libffmpeg.dylib.

objects.name: Indicator for libffmpeg.dylib (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of Smooth Operator universal binary packaged inside the malicious 3CX disk image.

objects.name: Indicator for libffmpeg.dylib (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of Smooth Operator universal binary packaged inside the malicious 3CX disk image.

objects.name: Indicator for libffmpeg.dylib (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of Smooth Operator universal binary packaged inside the malicious 3CX disk image.

objects.name: Indicator for UpdateAgent (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of Smooth Operator second-stage payload which exfiltrates 3CX victim data.

objects.name: Indicator for UpdateAgent (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of Smooth Operator second-stage payload which exfiltrates 3CX victim data.

objects.name: Indicator for UpdateAgent (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of Smooth Operator second-stage payload which exfiltrates 3CX victim data.

objects.name: smooth operator
objects.description: Smooth Operator is a macOS supply chain malware distributed as part of the 3CX supply chain attack. It infects victims via trojanised, signed, and notarized 3CX software packages, specifically targeting macOS systems. The malware consists of two stages: the first-stage is compiled into a dynamic library (libffmpeg.dylib) and distributed with the 3CX software, while the second-stage (UpdateAgent) is downloaded and executed by the first-stage. Smooth Operator exfiltrates victim data using a custom data encoding algorithm over HTTPS, randomises its C2 server selection, and implements various evasion and persistence techniques. It collects device information, exfiltrates data from 3CX configuration files, and deletes itself after execution to evade detection.

objects.name: updateagent
objects.description: UpdateAgent is the second-stage payload of Smooth Operator, executed on Intel x86_64 macOS systems. It exfiltrates victim data from 3CX configuration files, parses and extracts domain and account name values, and sends them to the C2 server using a custom obfuscation algorithm. The binary deletes itself from disk immediately after execution and is not notarized.

objects.name: 3CX
objects.description: 3CX is the legitimate software vendor whose supply chain was compromised, resulting in the distribution of trojanised software packages containing Smooth Operator malware.

objects.name: Apple
objects.description: Apple is referenced as the platform provider for macOS, whose notarization process was abused to distribute the trojanised 3CX software package containing Smooth Operator.

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies unique strings and code
present in the C2 string obfuscation code of Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"
        hash2 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:

    $ = {48 69 ?? 61 60 60 60 48 89 ?? 48 C1 EA 3F 48 C1 ?? 25 01

?? 6B ?? 55}

$ = "!#$%&()*+-

.0123456789:;<>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[]_abcdefghi"
$ = {3E00C7[5-6]26706572} // &per
$ = {3E00C7[5-6]26646F6C} // &dol
$ = {75733E00C7[5-6]26706C75} // &plus
$ = {6D693E00C7[5-6]2673656D} // &semi

    condition:

    ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or

(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and all of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation_2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation_2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies unique code sections in the
C2 string obfuscation algorithm."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"
        hash2 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:
        $a_1 = {4869C8616060604889CA48C1EA3F48C1F92501D16BC95529C8[0-
3]83F807}
        $b_1 = {438D1C24F7DB41F7DC} // neg
        $b_2 = {478D3C3641F7DF41F7DE} // neg

    condition:
        ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and any of ($b*)
and $a_1
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies broader functionality across
Smooth Operator, identifying strings observed throughout."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:
        $ = {80 [2] 7A 48 FF C0 48 83 F8 38} // .main_storage XOR loop
        $ = "<key>ProductVersion</key>"
        $ = ".session-lock"
        $ = "%s/.main_storage"
        $ = "%s/UpdateAgent"
        $ =
{3715001316161B554F544A5A522D13141E150D095A342E5A4B4A544A415A2D13144C4E41
5A024C4E535A3B0A0A161F2D1F1831130E554F494D54494C5A5231322E3736565A1613111
F5A3D1F191115535A39120815171F554B4A42544A544F494F43544B48425A291B1C1B0813
554F494D54494C} // XOR'd UA
        $ = {B02D[0-8]88470888470D884712884717C6472400} // victim ID
generation

    condition:

((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and 4 of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_C2_codes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_C2_codes {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies sections of code which are
responsible for parsing tasking command codes in Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:

$ = {80340F7A48FFC14839C8} // XOR deobfuscate tasking

        $ = {8B073D4938000074??3D018000008B4C24??0F[3-6]3D01900000} // C2
codes

    condition:

((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and all of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Sleeps
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Sleeps {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies algorithms used by the
malware developer to generate random time values in Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:

$ =

{E8[4]E8[4]89C14869C93FC5254348C1E9246BC93D29C86BE83C81C5100E0000B80F0000
00} // between beacon time generation

$ = {E8[4]E8[4]89C1490FAFCE48C1E9238D0C898D0C4929C8} // C2 index
$ =

{89E8D1E841BE932449924C0FAFF049C1EE224489F0C1E0044489F129C14101EE4101CE48
8DBC24[4]4C892FE8} // initial sleep

    condition:
        ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and any of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_II
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_II {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies strings observed in the
second stage of Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:
        $ = "3cx_auth_id=%s;3cx_auth_token_content=%s;__tutma=true"

  $ = "AccountName\":"

        $ = "url\": \"https://"
        $ = "%s/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop
App/.main_storage"
        $ = "%s/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop App/config.json"
        $ = "read_config"
        $ = "enc_text"
        $ = "send_post"
        $ = "parse_json_config"

    condition:

    ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or

(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and 5 of them
}

objects.name: Supply Chain Compromise: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools
objects.description: Smooth Operator is distributed via legitimate channels as trojanised, signed and notarized 3CX software.

objects.name: Compromise Client Software Binary
objects.description: Smooth Operator runs as part of the 3CX software.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Smooth Operator uses a custom algorithm to obfuscate data exfiltrated over the C2 channel. Smooth Operator deobfuscates data it writes to a file on disk as well as tasking responses.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: Smooth Operator’s second-stage deletes itself from disk immediately on execution.

objects.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: Time Based Evasion
objects.description: Smooth Operator sleeps for, at minimum, a week before beaconing.

objects.name: Automated Collection
objects.description: Smooth Operator stages collect data from the victim machine to be included in a beacon or exfiltration.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Smooth Operator command and control is over HTTPS.

objects.name: Fallback Channels
objects.description: Smooth Operator contains multiple C2 servers and randomly chooses a new server from the list for each beacon, if one fails it will try another.

objects.name: Automated Exfiltration
objects.description: Smooth Operator exfiltrates automatically collected data, not over the existing C2 channel.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Smooth Operator
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. smooth operator.
